message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you this great product at a special price. I think you'll really love it!
I'm interested in the product, but I think it's a bit pricey. Would you be willing to consider a lower price?
I understand you think it's pricey, but I have to make a living. I can do $160, and that's as low as I can go.
I understand your perspective, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. Would you be willing to meet me in the middle?
I can see you're really interested in the product, but I'm not willing to meet you in the middle just yet. I can do $145, and that's as close as I can get.
I'm still not convinced that's the best price. I'm willing to compromise, but I need to get closer to my target price. Can you meet me at $130?
I understand you're trying to get a good deal, but I've already compromised quite a bit. I can do $138, and that's as low as I'm willing to go.
I understand you've compromised, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. I'm willing to make one more offer. Can you meet me at $125?
I've already given you a great deal, and I'm starting to think you're not serious about buying the product. I can do $135, and that's my final offer.
I understand you're frustrated, but I'm not willing to pay more than $80. That's my final offer. If you're not willing to meet me at that price, I'll have to walk away and buy from John.
